reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We’ve been to Los Cabos, Puerto Vallarta and the Riviera Maya but are so impressed with Ixtapa that we are already planning next year’s vacation – back to the Barcelo Beach. reviews.title: Go for the weather, not the food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to the Barcelo resort in Ixtapa for our Christmas break in 2010. Pluses: The reliable weather-- 84 degrees for nine straight days of our visit, was the real attraction. We have never stayed so close to the beach. From our window in the junior suite, we could see the kids playing in the ocean. The service was excellent-- everyone was kind, helpful, and friendly. We have been on cruises before and this service was every bit as thorough as that of the Disney Cruise. The resort is very clean inside and out.
reviews.title: Barcelo Ixtapa provided an excellent holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The weather was the best i've ever experienced any where, the staff was great the food was good the locals were nice. The beach pirates got on my nerves but it's mexico so i expect it. It was the best holiday my wife and i had ever been on until we went to check out and were informed we were being billed for a "missing' robe from our room, my wife had worn it earlier and the week and put it in the bath tub for the maid to change out. The man behid the desk argued with me for almost half an hour untiil finally i had enough and started yelling loudly how i was going back to canada and was going to tell everyone i new bad a place it was to stay unless he dropped it. lol..guess i'm not keeping my word
reviews.title: Great Trip until Check out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: just came back from a week in Ixtapa at the Barcelo, incredible, quite a location with the 3 pools, the beautiful beach. The food was also very good we ate at the a la carte restaurants 3 times and they were very good as well. The service was first class, the room were very good as well, the only thing we could have hoped for is a balcony, we were in the villa section and some do not have balconies as did ours, but the size and spaciousness of the room made up for it, all in all the best 4 star that I been to in Mexico.
reviews.title: Barcelo and Ixtapa a hit!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My family and I stayed at the Barcelo Ixtapa from Jan 16th to the 21st and really I have nothing but good things to say. There were a few reviews that stated the hotel was old, not true. Also people complaining about the food, they must be very picky and quite the complainers... We stayed in a Villa which are oceanfront, there are 2 seperate villas with about 25 rooms in each, our agent did state that there would be a jacuzzi in each but that was incorrect there were a couple of jacuzzis in the villa area but however our rooms didn't have them. We had asked for adjoining rooms or side by side and when we arrived they had us in 2 different buildings, so please request that again at check in, if that applies to you. The rooms were quite adequate with a spectacular ocean view. We were ground floor so I can imagine the further up you would get the view probably got better and better. Also there is a pool outside of the villas that is specifically for the guests in the villas, it was never crowded and quite nice. There were plenty of chairs at all areas, however if you did want a good spot you did have to reserve a chair with your towel.
reviews.title: exceeded expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got 2 vouchers for the specialty restaurants so we ate at each one time. I had a filet at Don Quiote and a ribeye at sunset and the beef was very good for mexico. There is always plenty of food to choose from and if you can't find enough to fill you up, you shouldn't be traveling all inclusive. We go somewhere everyyear and I rate this #2 of all times for the food.... The drinks~ some were VERY strong some were not, find a good bartender and tip!
reviews.title: Best Location

description: Barcelo Ixtapa Beach***** is located in the heart of Ixtapa, right on "El Palmar" beach, one of the most attractive destinations in Mexico. It is the ideal place to go on family holidays, celebrate romantic weddings, organize successful business meetings and also to spend an unforgettable honeymoon. The Barcelo Ixtapa Beach***** hotel offers a convenient way to enjoy your holidays and experience the Barcelo All Inclusive program. It also offers the perfect location for those guests wanting to experience excursions to other parts of Ixtapa and Zihuatanejo.
